title: The race for excellence has no finish line
segmentation: Good morning everyone.
Thank you, professor, but itself for very inspiring presentation and four.
Sharing your thoughts about.
The future.
In the present moment of the education.
I will start where actually you stopped.
In education in last few years or decades we are facing the trends like in the fashion industry.
And now somehow we have trend of machine learning, trend of artificial intelligence, trend of virtual reality of augmented reality and so on and so forth.
Even though those tools are important in the future learning process, I'm 100% convinced.
That there is no machine that can replace human factor.
Neither in teaching nor in research.
If it could be able to replace human factor.
Then America would be able.
To predict how the flu.
Epidemia will go based on Big Data they could not.

Just think about it and bearing this in mind and bearing in mind that I'm coming from the Middle East, which became place for state of the art experiences when it comes to ER and to educational tools.
And techniques.
I will try to blend.
Some traditional experiences with some modern achievements and in a few minutes to give a short overview.
About everything for this I have to thank to Doctor Season for invitation.

Have to thank to Professor and kids from Hamdan bin Mohammed Smart University to Professor Abilash Sync from American University in the Emirates and Dubai Fashion College and to His Excellency Faysal Mohamed Al Shammari, director of Smart Government UAE who gave their insights and helped me to prepare this presentation to reflect as much as possible what is going on there?
My name is Marco Sala kuch.
And as Ruler of Dubai and Prime Minister of the UAE said the race for excellence has no finish line.
You can never.
Excel enough.
And we can never Excel enough.
This sentence is true in many fields for life, but in education it is especially true.
Whatever we do can go.
To the next level and it can go further and it should go further.
So in the United Arab Emirates in particular.
In last few years, education became part of wider strategic framework, and that's actually.
Very strong, very positive move which pushed the entire educational system forward very quickly.
What happened?
You lounged.
Let's say the umbrella document on national level called UA Vision 2021.
Yeah, Vision 2021 is actually vision of the country.
How the country should look like in 2021 and which indicators which KP eyes should be achieved by that time it has four pillars.
It is SoC and preserved identity.
Which is reflected in responsibility, safe, public and fair judiciary reflected through destiny.
Competitive knowledge economy, which is of course relating very closely to knowledge.
And United in Prosperity where first rate education system is one of the pillars.
So out of four pillars.
Of the National vision of the umbrella document to closely relate with education?
That's quite a strong, quite a good basis, and quite a positive basis to work further on it.
When you take a look in to keep the eyes because within each pillar you have keeping eyes.
You see that Global Innovation Index Global Competitiveness Index, JD share of knowledge workers in the labor force and increase of research and development expenditure within GDP.
All these indicators are again closely linked to advancements in the educational system.
When it comes to first rate education system, it reflects at all levels.
Now in the moment, the strongest reform moves are happening on level of primary and secondary schools where curricula are becoming unified.
But in addition to this.
The transformation of entire education system and teaching methods.
At all levels is required if we want to achieve this.
If we want to become more innovative, more competitive.
To have more enterpreneurs to have more knowledge workers, we have to change the approach and we have to change the methods.
Therefore.
Emphasis put on soft skills now.
In addition.
Open resources and elearning are widely promoted within the professional community.
Then have done bin Mohammed Smart University is the first the first University which introduced full comprehensive E learning platform in the somewhere in 2012.
What is certain deley comparing to some other countries?
For example, Slovenia introduced to be introduced it more than 20 years ago.
As far as I know, but still it is good and the good fact is that Ministry of Higher Education, an sceintific research recognized officially open education.
And the learning concepts there is list of open universities.
There is list of open resources and so on and so forth.
So it is very accessible, very accessible for the people.
In addition.
When you look into universities, more specifically, the paradigm is changing.
It started as pure teaching.
And still there are universities which have only teaching in this paradigm.
But now it starts to shift from teaching.
Towards actually developing knowledge.
Knowledge development is the key word from my point of view.
Teaching is also a tool.
To develop knowledge to develop such skills.
What is done further on?
All student skills are analyzed in order to advise them which mayors to select.
And how their skill set will be suitable with their future profession.
How to proceed with further specialization?
Then how to introduce experiential learning here?
Free verse, open platforms and many our tools are used in experiential learning.
It is not only internship.
People miss believe that internship is the only way to have experiential learning.
No.
Oh, you are also gives huge opportunities.
Pretty experiential learning.
Then very important thing is that committee for Academic Accreditation which is responsible.
For academic accreditation of the universities.
By its regulations, encourages universities to move forward.
Do you so you are to stay online as much as possible and so on so forth.
And last but not least, within changes of the paradigm is that now students are introduced into the academic.
Academic research, for example.
One example you can later visit the link what was presented few months ago at Innovation Arabia Conference.
Actually one of the articles done by students research paper done by students about use of mobile phones and and and Facebook and other social media in the learning process.
So it is moving forward.
And that's actually a good sign.
I will give you just short overview of two universities.
One is fully Open University, come down with Mohammed Smart University which has open education platform in the center of the process.
It has online learning platform called Cloud Campus which is actually solution how they call it for 21st century learner.
It has strong network, strong partnerships.
It is at the same time Innovation Hub.
It has smart campus concept as well, and estore for the students accompanied with the library with number of free softwares and so on and so forth.
So all these things.
They moved in the virtual space as much as they can.
And they managed to do it successfully.
From the other hand, American University in the Emirates, for example.
Also developed its own platform called Academia, which works quite well.
I have had some experience with it, so I can testify it works.
Students interact with teachers both offline and online.
And also students are involved into research work very strongly.
Curricula are fine tuned and adjusted to meet.
The need for development of soft skills.
Eportfolios and online resources are also available.
And of course there is really a myriad of free wears.
I think hundreds of free wares are available both for faculty and for students.
There is another question.
It is how much our faculty members today are trained.
And how much they are skilled?
To utilize all the benefits of smart learning concepts and avoid our.
Do they really have those skills or not?
I firmly believe we can.
Do a lot of efforts to improve this field because it is highly, highly needed.
Academic research.
Would be further encouraged.
It is neverending story definitely.
When it comes to blended learning also, it is never ending story.
You can never blend enough but you have to take into account what you need to achieve that students should go out with the knowledge, not with the degree.
At the end of the day, degree is a tool as well.
Tool for better job or for higher salary.
But knowledge is something what is really demanded, not the paper.
Paper is same like entrance ticket.
If you want to enjoy the game or concept you have to pay the entrance.
That's why degree is needed.
But real joy and real work comes from knowledge and from skills you have.
Universities in the UK still have couple of challenges as most of them are quite young.
They need stronger academic interconnections, especially with Europe.

There are some to certain extent connected with the US universities in UK universities, but with universities within European Union they need more connection, more access to the research funds, more access to knowledge databases, more access to exchange of information with colleagues with their peers from European universities, and I believe there is huge room to improve the things.
Content production is one of the issues UA is facing.
It's not the problem to install the software, it's not the problem to create the platform.
The point is how to make the content and how to manage the content which will be well aligned with the platform and which will be well utilized by both faculty members and students.
Then I said training yes absolutely and use it or freeware.
Yes, absolutely as as well as other lawyer.
Before I finish.
I would like to ask you just to think about.
What are the needs and what are the habits?
Of 21st century learner.
I'm quite convinced that this generation of learners has just a few things in common with even our generation or with generation of my parents.
They are moving very strongly in technological sense.
They live with mobile phone.
They're not using it there, living with it.
They are living in era of Internet of real time information and of virtual world.
Therefore, I firmly believe that University deduct ticks.
Should match those needs and habits in order to be successful, and if there is no transformation towards this.
To match the needs and habits.
I'm not convinced we will manage to transfer the knowledge.
To the extent we could, we will transfer some knowledge, but we cannot perform our best if we do not feel how they learn.
How they think and how they act in everyday life.
For all these things.
E Concepts Smart solutions online integrated platforms.
Absolutely should be among the key tools to achieve real learning.
Knowledge transfer and to make sure that they will learn lifelong.
In all these things we are.
Is really.
Precious asset.
And precious advantage.
Do use to develop.
Empty hands.
Therefore I would just want to say thank you and to stay open for the discussion.
